laboratory_examinations.findings: Severe prosthetic valve stenosis with peak/mean gradient of 149/98 mm Hg, dimensionless velocity index 0.28, aortic valve area 0.8 cmÂ², no aortic valve regurgitation, mild concentric left ventricular hypertrophy, hyperdynamic left ventricular systolic function, no evidence of pulmonary hypertension.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased gradients observed over time, previous echocardiogram showed mild prosthetic valve aortic stenosis with peak/mean gradient of 41/27 mm Hg.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Confirmed severe bioprosthetic aortic stenosis without evidence of thrombus, pannus formation, or valvular vegetation.
Functioning bioprosthetic aortic valve with peak/mean gradients of 43/27 mm Hg, no regurgitation, left ventricular ejection fraction >70%.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Comparison with pre-procedure results shows improvement after intervention.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Largely unremarkable with normal troponin values, no anemia, and normal thyroid function.
Sinus tachycardia with normal axis, normal intervals, borderline left ventricular hypertrophy.
